title: How to Make Penguin Meatballs Bento

steps.headline: Cut the two cheese slices into an artist's palette shape using a toothpick.
steps.description: The size should be matched to the meatball. See the image for the exact shape. Lay each piece of cheese on the meatball surface. Place in the microwave for 9 seconds to melt it onto the meatball surface.

steps.headline: Cut the sweet potato into a beak shape.
steps.description: Cut a rectangle and gently scoop out a dip in the middle to create two little beak peaks each end of the rectangle. Place the beak on each penguin's cheese face.

steps.headline: Add nori eyes.
steps.description: Cut tiny round eyes from nori. Place each eye on the penguin's cheese faces. Add a single black sesame seed to create an eyelash per eye. That's the penguin completed.

steps.headline: Arrange the bento.
steps.description: At the base of the bento container, create a thin protein layer using the crushed meatballs.

steps.headline: Place the cooked rice in one half of the bento container.
steps.description: See image in the introduction for an example.

steps.headline: Following the introductory image, create the salad arrangement:
steps.description: Run lettuce across the middle of the arrangement, frilly edge facing up. Arrange the fish jun and kiwi slices around the edge of the other half of the container. Carefully insert the cherry tomatoes, blackberries and pea pods.

steps.headline: Place the half boiled quail egg into place.
steps.description: On top of it, gently add a small nori star.

steps.headline: Cut two fish shapes from the steamed fish potato.
steps.description: (You will need a fish shaped cutter for this if you're not adept at cutting freestyle.) Place into the arrangement.

steps.headline: Cut a fish from the fish sausage.
steps.description: To make the scales, use one half of the end of a drinking straw to make the shape. Place into the arrangement.

steps.headline: Take your penguin meatballs bento to work for lunch.
steps.description: Alternatively, serve up to your fussy kids who will love this for a change!

text: Cut the two cheese slices into an artist's palette shape using a toothpick. The size should be matched to the meatball. See the image for the exact shape. Lay each piece of cheese on the meatball surface. Place in the microwave for 9 seconds to melt it onto the meatball surface. Cut the sweet potato into a beak shape. Cut a rectangle and gently scoop out a dip in the middle to create two little beak peaks each end of the rectangle. Place the beak on each penguin's cheese face. Add nori eyes. Cut tiny round eyes from nori. Place each eye on the penguin's cheese faces. Add a single black sesame seed to create an eyelash per eye. That's the penguin completed. Arrange the bento. At the base of the bento container, create a thin protein layer using the crushed meatballs. Place the cooked rice in one half of the bento container. See image in the introduction for an example. Following the introductory image, create the salad arrangement: Run lettuce across the middle of the arrangement, frilly edge facing up. Arrange the fish jun and kiwi slices around the edge of the other half of the container. Carefully insert the cherry tomatoes, blackberries and pea pods. Place the half boiled quail egg into place. On top of it, gently add a small nori star. Cut two fish shapes from the steamed fish potato. (You will need a fish shaped cutter for this if you're not adept at cutting freestyle.) Place into the arrangement. Cut a fish from the fish sausage. To make the scales, use one half of the end of a drinking straw to make the shape. Place into the arrangement. Take your penguin meatballs bento to work for lunch. Alternatively, serve up to your fussy kids who will love this for a change!
